description: Part demolition of several buildings, erection of two part two part three storey buildings, erection of two part two part three storey temporary buildings throughout build of permanent buildings, hard and soft landscaping, new entrance from Grennell Road, new cycle and car parking.
decision_conditions: Occupier
The development must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date hereof.Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended.

Prior to the occupation of the development, full details of hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. All hard and soft landscaping and tree planting shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and to a reasonable standard in accordance with the relevant recommendations of appropriate British Standards (in particular, BS 3882:  Specifications for Topsoil, Recommendations (2015) and BS 8545:  Trees from Nursery to Independence in the Landscape, Recommendations (2014) or other recognised codes of good practice). The works shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part or relevant phase of the development or in accordance with the timetable agreed with the Local Planning Authority. Any tree(s) or plants that (within a period of five years after planting) are removed, die, or (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) are damaged or defective shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably practicable with others of a similar size/species/number as originally approved, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its consent to any variation. Reason: To ensure the provision, establishment and maintenance of a reasonable standard of landscape in accordance with the approved designs in accordance with Policy 28 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Before any external facing materials are erected or installed on site, external facing materials including windows treatments and finishes shall submitted for the formal written approval of the local planning authority. The development must then be carried out and maintained in accordance with the approved details. Reason: To ensure that the new buildings make a positive contribution to the streetscene and complement the retained buildings on the site, in compliance with Policy 28 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

No boundary fences, gates or other perimeter enclosures must be erected until details of such structures, at scale of 1:5 or 1:10 have been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The development must then be carried out and maintained in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure that the boundary treatments make a positive contribution to the streetscene, in compliance with Policy 28 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

All windows on the temporary buildings immediately abutting the north east and north west boundaries of the site must be obscured glazed and either fixed shut or fitted with opening width restrictors and maintained as such for the entire period the buildings are on site.Reason: To protect the privacy and amenity of neighbouring residential occupiers, in accordance with Policy 29 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

All temporary buildings, including classrooms on the site of the current artificial playing pitches at the northern end of the site, and construction-related buildings, plant installations and site compounds, must be removed within three years of being erected on site. The artificial playing pitches and any ancillary associated infrastucture, including fencing and footpaths, must then be restored to their previous condition.Reason: The siting of buildings in this location is only acceptable on the basis that they are temporary and necessary in order to carry out the development while maintaining a functioning school. The condition ensures that pitches are not lost permanently and that completed development will have sufficient outdoor sports provision in accordance with Policy 25 of the Sutton Local Plan.

All trees shown to be retained shall be subject to protective measures that meet the British Standard BS5837: Trees. The protective measures shall be put in place prior to the permission being implemented (including demolition and site enabling works) and only be removed on completion of the development.  Reason: To ensure retained trees and their root protection areas will not be damaged during demolition or construction in accordance with best practice and Policy 28 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Before any demolition or construction work begins, a pre-commencement meeting shall be held on site and attended by the developer's appointed arboricultural consultant, the site manager/foreman and a representative from the Local Planning Authority (LPA) to agree that the installed tree protection measures have been installed in accordance with the British Standard BS5837: Trees. The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the British Standard.Reason: Required prior to the commencement of development in order that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that the trees to be retained will not be damaged during development works and to ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with BS5837 pursuant to section 197 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and Policy 28 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Full details of the secure cycle storage facilities shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority  showing their positioning within the site, the size and materials of the enclosure and the means of access. The approved details shall be implemented on site prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure the development provides an adequate level of cycle parking facilities and to encourage sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with Policies 36 and 37 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

All demolition and construction must be carried out in accordance with the approved Construction Logistics Management Plan.Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not interfere with the free flow of traffic and conditions of safety on the public highway, and to ensure the development process does not have a significant adverse impact on the amenities of nearby residential properties, in accordance with Policy 36 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented, monitored and enforced in accordance with the approved details.Reason: In order to promote sustainable transport choices, encourage access by non-car modes and reduce the need to travel especially by car, in accordance with Policies 35 and 36 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The rating level of any noise emitted from fixed plant and equipment permitted as part of this development shall not exceed L Ar,1hour 36dB during the day and L Ar,15mins 35dB at night. The noise levels shall be measured or calculated 1m externally to any window at the nearest residential facade. Measurements and assessments shall be made according to British Standard BS4142:2014.Reason: To prevent harm to the amenity of neighbouring residents by way of excessive noise, in accordance with Policies 29 and 34 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The site and building works required to implement the development shall be only carried out between the hours of 08.00 and 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 and 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays.Reason: To prevent harm to the amenity of neighbouring residents by way of noise and vibration, in accordance with Policy 34 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

If, during the course of development, any contamination is found which has not been previously identified, work shall be suspended and additional measures for its remediation shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The remediation of the site shall incorporate the approved additional measures and a verification report for all the remediation works shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To prevent harm to human health and pollution of the environment in accordance with the aims and objectives of Policy 34 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development must be carried out in accordance with the dust management mitigation measures set out in the following approved documents listed in Condition 1: -  Section 7 (Dust Management) of the Construction Environment Management Plan prepared by Bowmer + Kirkland (revision P1) dated 2 March 2023; and-  Table 18 (Fugitive Dust Emission Mitigation Measures) of the Air Quality Assessment prepared by Redmore Environmental (ref: 6480r1) dated 22 February 2023.Reason: To manage construction impacts, including dust and air quality, in accordance with Policy 34 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/Reason: To ensure that the development would not result in a deterioration of air quality. This condition is required to be pre-commencement to mitigate against the impacts of the demolition / construction process.

The development must be carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Planning Fire Safety Strategy prepared by Ashton Fire dated 10 January 2023 (ref: SRP1027-AFR-XX-XX-T-K-0002 Issue P02)Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates the necessary fire safety measures in accordance with the Mayor's London Plan Policy D12.

The development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the details stipulated within the submitted Preliminary Ecology Appraisal, Bat Surveys and Biodiversity Net Gain Assessment (refs: RT-MME159483-01, 02 and 03, and RT-MME160122-01), The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter retained.Reason: To enhance and protect the biodiversity value of the land in accordance with Policy 26 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the details stipulated within the Energy Strategy prepared by Cundall (ref: SRP1027-CDL-XX-XX-T-M-0010). The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter retained.Reason:  To comply with Policy 31 and 33 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Prior to the erection of superstructure, an overheating strategy incorporating the results of dynamic thermal modelling analysis must be submitted for each of the proposed buildings demonstrating compliance with the relevant criteria in CIBSE Guidance TM52. The proposed overheating strategy must include appropriate mitigation measures to reduce the risk of overheating through use of the CIBSE DSY2 and DSY3 weather files, and a strategy for occupants to deal with extreme heatwaves. Reason: To comply with Local Plan Policy 33 and London Plan Policy SI 4

Condition: Prior to first occupation of the buildings, documentary evidence including finalised dynamic thermal modelling results must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing which demonstrates that the overheating strategy has been implemented in line with the approved detailsReason: To comply with Local Plan Policy 33 and London Plan Policy SI 4

Prior to the commencement of development (excluding demolition) a BREEAM Interim (Design Stage) Certificate, issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE) or equivalent authorising body, must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that an 'Excellent' rating will be achieved under the BREEAM New Construction Version 6.0 Education (Fully Fitted) scheme.Reason: To comply with Policy 31 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Condition: Within three months of first occupation of the last building, a BREEAM Final (Post-Construction) Certificate, issued by the BRE or equivalent authorising body, must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that an 'Excellent' BREEAM rating has been achieved under the BREEAM New Construction Version 6.0 Education (Fully Fitted) scheme All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.Reason: To comply with Policy 31 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Prior to the commencement of development above ground, documentary evidence must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development will achieve an increase in overall green space coverage of at least 10% and an improved Green Space Factor (GSF) score of at least +0.2 compared to the baseline GSF score prior to redevelopment. The council's GSF scoring system set out in the council's 'Technical Guidance Note - Building a Sustainable Sutton' (June 2018) must be used for this purpose. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter retained.Reason: To comply with Policy 33 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018

Prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding demolition), if consent has been received to discharge to the surface water sewer in third party land then the applicant must submit to the Local Planning Authority for review and approval, a revised drainage strategy compliant to the drainage hierarchy (in this case, discharge into a surface water sewer). Where discharge to a surface water sewer as stated above is not possible, the applicant should provide a letter confirming consent from Thames Water to discharge into their combined/foul water sewer. If the discharge rate is required to be changed to achieve consent for discharge to the combined/foul water sewer, a revised drainage strategy, including drawings should be submitted accordingly. Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with relevant policy requirements including but not limited to London Plan Policy SI 13, its associated Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems.

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the drainage strategy with any revisions required for the discharge of Condition 27. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components. Reason: To comply with the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems, the National Planning Policy Framework (Paragraph 167), the London Plan (Policy SI 13) along with associated guidance to these policies.
